title: where can I get mIDA
content: Some posts reference the mIDA plugin, but the download site seems unavailable. Is there any mirror or a link to an archive version?

comments.text: try to ask directly to author, you've his email
I couldn't find mIDA online, so I e-mailed the author.
@Ange: how about setting up a mirror on Bitbucket or Github, the license allowing, and then answer with that? Edit: oh or on Google Code ... your site is there of course.

yeah, that would be good, but I don't see myself maintaining a file archive on top of the rest: why Woodman or Openrce didn't host a local copy is beyond me. It would be trivial to also put it on a google code project, but I'm not sure that's compatible with the licences.
I don't think the source has been released so this discussion is moot so far.

answers_data.content:
I was just sent mIDA-1.0.10, from 2008.

```
mIDA is an IDA plugin which extracts RPC interfaces and recreates the associated IDL file.
mIDA supports inline, interpreted and fully interpreted server stubs.

```

comments.text: I didn't get it from the author (no answer yet), so there might be a newer version.
mIDA_v1.0.10.zip can also be found at Aaron Portnoy's site  here as well, for another source, but I'm likewise unsure if that is the latest version.
The link is not accessible..can you please update the link if possible..please?
